issue.title: Bug: Infinite selection update in LexicalLinkPlugin on Playground
issue.body:
Lexical version: v0.12.2

## Steps To Reproduce

1. Add link to the document on https://playground.lexical.dev/
2. Update the selection as in the attached video by slowly moving the mouse cursor down

https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/10223953/bb28a403-fb82-4f6b-a9b9-68d228ff5bd0

## The current behavior
Selection is changed infinitely to the whole document and back to what was initially selected

## The expected behavior
Selection stays fixed

issue.title: Fixes grid selection to be aware of nested tables

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

issue.body:
## Why
As pointed in #4647 Table selection behaved with issue on moving selection between nested tables. What happened is that we expect nodes anchor/focus (from/to) to be in the same grid by default, but it isn't true for nested tables.

## What
Here after finding focus and anchor cells we check if grids for both of them are equal - that would mean we are on the same level, if not we are moving one selection up. This change makes selection behaviour as next:
- If we move focus from higher level to lower - same higher cell to be selected.
- If we move focus from nested level to level above (any cell) that would mean we make whole original cell to be focused.
- If we move focus from higher to same level including some of nested tables - they will be skipped to focus higher level cells.

Before:

https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/5208565/59dcb11c-c267-4b29-947f-2ef1840ea61f


After:

https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/5208565/2f526ffa-4cec-4ba0-bfbb-5d7b53690ca8

I cannot reproduce it locally on this branch, could you please share video steps?

issue.title: Bug w/Repro Repo: Custom node and plugin causes TextNode to strip trailing whitespace on importDOM
issue.body:
tl;dr: The issue is when the $generateNodesFromDOM function runs, the Lexical TextNode has it's trailing whitespace stripped out when followed by my custom node.

I'm trying to build out my own extended formatting text node. Currently this example only has a bold option, but I'm looking to utilize this to provide different font-weights, among other things. I have steps recorded via Windows Steps Recorder, but I essentially created a few plugins to create a custom text node, load existing html that is formatted for our requirements, and a toolbar. When I format my custom node via one of the buttons on the toolbar, it adds a class to the node. On exportDOM, I create my own custom HTML tag for our internal storage. On importDOM, I translate that custom tag to be a span with the correct class. 

Lexical version: ^0.12.0

## Steps To Reproduce

1. Hit "Primary" button to enable the editor
2. Highlight "something" and hit the bold icon button. Text is bolded
3. Hit the check button icon to close the editor. Text is still bolded.
4. Hit "Primary" button again to enable the editor. Unbolded text now has it's trailing space removed

![lexical-repro](https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/35585841/f03963f7-b541-4e76-bf64-2e16ca7f7c38)

It's a nextjs app. Clone the repo, and from the root folder run `npm run dev`.
Link to code example: https://github.com/JakeHadley/lexical-test

## The current behavior
Lexical TextNode whitespace is stripped out on importDOM

## The expected behavior
The text should appear in the editor the same way as it appears outside the editor

issue.title: Bug: Jumping through hoops to make Lexical work with latest Remix.run

comment.body: Same problem here, thanks for the example so can manage to make it work somehow, even if syntax is weird.

issue.title: Bug: `ListMaxIndentLevelPlugin` allows indent beyond `maxDepth` on paste
issue.body:
The playground has a max depth of 7 for list indents but you can bypass it by pasting the indents as shown in the screen recording

https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/54323745/594036f3-5ffb-43ea-8a84-3bc72bd49ad7

Lexical version: `0.12.2`

## Steps To Reproduce

1. Go to https://playground.lexical.dev/ it has indent maxDepth of 7
2. Paste indented list having depth more than 7, you'll be able to paste it successfully

## The current behavior
maxDepth for `ListMaxIndentLevelPlugin` only stops directly indenting lists in the editor

## The expected behavior
Even when pasting indented content it should still adhere to maxDepth by the editor, it should remove those extra indents.

commits.message: Table resize handle getting stuck fix (#5169)

pull_request.title: Table resize fix
pull_request.body:
This fixes the bug of being stuck in the resizing mode for the table
Before:
![table resize](https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/29728044/990a0f35-b75d-4eae-8596-825d13877aa8)
After:
![table resize fixed](https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/29728044/c3b84485-723a-4c1e-bae7-edfff22a78b2)


Also changed the calculation of cell width for the new cell width to match the user selection.
Before: 
![table resize no move](https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/29728044/1e2d9777-a90f-459b-99ff-227e3da6c468)
After:
![table resize no move fixed](https://github.com/facebook/lexical/assets/29728044/d69b9c9a-c4b3-4e11-a34b-4c365af5af86)

issue.title: Add Optional Chaining to `isNodePre` Method

labels.name: CLA Signed
labels.description: This label is managed by the Facebook bot. Authors need to sign the CLA before a PR can be reviewed.

issue.body:
## Description
Addresses issue: #5156 

~~Adds optional chaining to the boolean check of the `isNodePre` method inside of the `LexicalTextNode.ts` file. This will allow for support for other DOM parsing libraries outside of JSDOM, like LinkeDOM.~~

## Update
+ Converts optional chaining to check if the style and whitespace properties are defined before the `startsWith` check.
+ Also ran `prettier:fix` command to update syntax styling.

comment.body: @acywatson @zurfyx Looks like the only failing test is the e2e-collab-linux test within chromium. Do tests need to be run again?
